The Next Trend Designs
Website Redesign

Overview

*please note that changes to the current The Next Trend Designs website are not my own*

The Next Trend Design's websiteÂ needed a new 2017 makeover. Below is the layout that was last updated in 2014:

The Problem

TNT is a small, family owned promotional products business, therefore, they did not have an inside dev team or UI/UX designer. Always up for a challenge and learning experience to gain more skills, I took initiative and enrolled in U of Michigan's edX Principals of Designing for Humans & UxDesign: From Concept to Wireframe. This gave me a good kickstart of beginner knowledge to start my first website design.

The Process

My role was to collaborate with the sales & marketing team to create a new look with additional features. By following UI/UX design principles, I created a layout that is simple and easy for users to navigate through the site. Here are some of my notes and sketches:

The Solution

My website redesign helped give TNT an easy to navigate and up to date website allowing new marketing & sales opportunities. Throughout my time at TNT, it was my responsibility to regularly update the rotating banners, product photos and blog posts through a custom CMS built by ASI.
